titleStmt.title: Despatch from Samuel S. Sevier to Thomas F. Bayard, January 31, 1887

bibl.title: Despatch from Samuel S. Sevier to Thomas F. Bayard
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Mr. S. S. Sevier
To the Sec'y of State.
Nomination for the Presidency and Vice Presidency by the Whigh party.
The Whigh party's nominees are Hon. H. R. W. Johnson and J. W. Thompson.

Hon. T. F. Bayard
Secretary of State
Washington D.C.

I have the honor to inform you that at the convention of the "Whigh Party" held at Clayashland on the 20th of Jany the present incumbents the Hon. H. R. W. Johnson received nomination for the presidency of the Republic and Hon. J. W. Thompson Vice.
These nominees I am glad to pay him the confidence of the people at large and no doubt success will crown them in the coming campaign. The political feeling of the people is more aroused than usual. I pray health be yours during the year upon which you have entered.

I am, Sir,
Your obedient servant
Sam'l S. Sevier
Acting U.S. Consul Gen.
